review: 2500 hours of my life I poured into this game with over 1600 hours on my beloved Doomfist hero reaching Top 15 and feeling no accomplishment unlike when I reached 4.4k In OW1. I'm mentally drained from complaining about the state of the game Blizzard had so many chances and they ruined it every time. I'm not even going to go into detail about the stupid decisions this company has made over the last 3 years from balance to monetisation because its been said a million times before. I love OW I really do, I miss this game, the way it was, the T500 community and actual "Competitive" before it turned into casual. Im not wasting more time of my life caring about this game anymore. I'm always going to remember the good times I had and the friends I made playing Overwatch. GG Bliz

Overwatch 2 is a totally horrible thing to happen to the Overwatch community, everything about this "Free to play" game seems just like blizzard are trying to take advantage of people's wallets to earn the most money possible, and the awful thing about this is that the people who payed money for Overwatch 1 were pretty much given a big "fuck you" for Overwatch 2. Overwatch 2 should've never been made, and Blizzard shouldn't have made all of the promises they tried making, because Overwatch 2 in it's current condition is just such a depressing game, and a huge let down.

[h1]The current state of the game is a shadow of its former self, marred by practices that do not favor the players.[/h1]

I have thousands of hours in Overwatch and reached GM in every role. Overwatch [b]was[/b] my favorite game of all time, but in the past few years, things have taken a bad turn.

Back in 2016, the game stood out to me with its fresh approach to the competitive shooter genre. My passion continued through my college years in 2018, where I even started to compete at the collegiate level. Though the balance was sometimes terrible (e.g., Goats, double shield, double sniper), I sensed a genuine effort and passion from the developers. However, with the announcement of Overwatch 2 and the PVE, my excitement was followed with skepticism - a skepticism that, unfortunately, has been justified.

The core of this game has been eroded by corporate greed, poor management, and decisions attributed to Bobby Kotick. Now free to play, Activision Blizzard appears determined to capitalize on every facet of the game, from battle passes to $15 PVE "missions," reselling old skins, charging for heroes, eliminating free loot boxes, and even undermining the vitality of the Overwatch League.

The current state of the game is a shadow of its former self, marred by practices that do not favor the players. I find myself unable to recommend Overwatch now or in the future, unless there is a monumental shift in Activision Blizzard's approach to become a company that values its community once again.

O MESMO JOGO DOIS MUDA PORRA NENHUMA TODO DESBALANCIADO SO LANÃ‡A SUPORTE E TANK E MESMO ASSIM EU CONTINUO JOGANDO POR QUE EU QUERO FAZER O QUE NE BLIZZARD

I don't care about the PVE content fiasco. Each "limited time" PVE event they did so far was middling at best. Still a horribly mismanaged live service title that was far more enjoyable in its first year than now. Its not exactly that I disagreed with the game's vision, but more so OW had years of number adjustment balance patches all done by a balance team with obviously didn't play the game outside of "work". I don't like MOBAs so my hot/cold take is that the 24 at launch was more than enough heroes, we didn't need a content dripfeed where new maps came slower than heroes.

The big positives is the hit detection and overbearing moderation were annoying for 2016 standards, but compared to the cucked experience of modern FPS titles its not all too bad, people can still release some "steam" in chat. I also hit 165fps @1440p on my ancient PC so the optimization team deserves some credit.

Overwatch 2 was announced as a buy-once-and-play PvE sequel with customisation skill trees for characters.
Overwatch 2 is a balance patch in which they removed their principles and a tank to add monetisation where ever they could.

Overwatch 1 shouldn't have died for this.
